meanings.definition: A steep rock face, especially at the edge of the sea.
meanings.sent1: The cliffs by the ocean were tall and rocky.
meanings.sent2: Tourists love to visit the cliffs by the beach for the stunning views.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the cliffs, looking out at the waves below.
meanings.sent4: The cliffs stood like ancient guardians, watching over the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The cliffs jutted out into the sea, casting a shadow over the sandy shore.

meanings.definition: A high, steep face of rock.
meanings.sent1: Hikers marveled at the towering cliffs that surrounded them.
meanings.sent2: The climbers scaled the cliffs with skill and determination.
meanings.sent3: The goats leaped from cliff to cliff, their hooves echoing off the rocks.
meanings.sent4: The cliffs loomed overhead, their jagged edges cutting into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cliffs seemed to touch the clouds, reaching for the heavens above.

meanings.definition: A steep, high rock face, especially one that runs along the edge of the sea.
meanings.sent1: The cliffs along the coast provided a breathtaking backdrop for the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The waves crashed against the cliffs, sending spray into the air.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek among the cliffs, their laughter echoing off the rocks.
meanings.sent4: The cliffs stretched out into the distance, like a giant stone dragon.
meanings.sent5: The cliffs gleamed in the sunlight, their ancient faces weathered by time.
